#labels Support
*Software Recommendations*

= Introduction =
A lot of software out there will enable you to work with this project, so what you use will be largely up to you. You will need something that can import/export to .wav, and some way to browse & edit the SVN Repository which is where the files are stored and tracked.


= Music Software =
There are a lot of options for Music software, here's some to get you started:

== Composing ==
  * [http://www.energy-xt.com EnergyXT]  ($53 USD, very awesome DAW/Sequencer for Windows/Linux/Mac)
  * [http://www.ardour.org/ Ardour] (Free open source DAW for Linux)
  * [http://www.rosegardenmusic.com/ Rosegarden] (Free open source MIDI & Audio sequencing & composition for Linux.)

== Wave Editors ==
  * [http://audacity.sourceforge.net/ Audacity] (Free software for recording and editing audio files)

== Plugins ==
  * [http://www.kvraudio.com/get.php Search KVR Audio Plugin Database]

== SVN Clients == 
  * [http://tortoisesvn.tigris.org/ TortoiseSVN] (Subversion shell extension for Windows)
  * [http://rapidsvn.tigris.org/ RapidSVN] (GUI Subversion client for Linux)
